Key Arguments: The proposed ACMA powers are incompatible with freedom of speech.
The proposal assumes that truth can be objectively determined by a government-appointed panel or experts, which is flawed.
Recent experiences with official statements on Covid-19 demonstrate the challenges of determining truth, as initial claims were later revised.
Controversial topics should be open for discussion without government interference.
Government coercive powers could undermine trust in governments and institutions more than online misinformation.
Notable Quotes: The stated aims 'to tackle harmful online misinformation and disinformation while balancing freedom of speech' are incompatible.
Recent experience with official Covid-19 statements... exposes the futility of such an approach.
Government coercive powers have no legitimate role here and are far more likely to 'undermine trust in governments and institutions' than any amount of alleged on-line misinformation.
